Perhaps not an authority, but as the key speaker(the one being 
advertised), I think it's important for anyone interested in going 
to know what they're paying for.  Will Jiro Asada be presenting 
anything insightful, or will this just be a press junket for his 
latest Shinsengumi-based novel?  I guess a better example would be 
if the marquee speaker is the scriptwriter for that god-awful NHK 
Shinsengumi series airing right now.  He may have done some research 
to write the script, but I doubt anyone would want to pay to hear 
his "knowledge" of the Shinsengumi.

I'm wondering if Hillsborough will be doing anything like this, 
especially when his new book comes out?

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "secretary" <secretarytocapt3@h...> 
wrote:
> Well, we didn't say he is an authority on the Shinsengumi. I doubt
> many people would dare to make that claim seeing how in the short 
time
> period the Shinsengumi existed, their intense record would cause
> people to divide up different aspects of their duties and battle
> theatres (Toba Fushimi, Nagarayema, Aizu and Hakodate).
> 
> At the request of SAitou, his secretary has made numerous calls now
> and spoke to 2 different people...all I can say is this JAL has
> contact info for translators in San Francisco and Torrance...It is 
UP
> TO THEM to do their part.  If you guys are interested please call 
them
> and urge them to acquire translators...my goodness there are grad
> students who would do this for free.
